publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Sr 08:
When I saw you to-day, as I went with Lḍ Anglesey
Lord! said I, Who's that Parson? how Awkardly dangles he!
When Whip You Trot up, without minding Your Betters,
To the Very Coach side, and threaten Your Letters
Is the Poison and Dagger You boast in Your Jaws Trow?
Are You still in yr Cart with Convitia Ex Plaustro?
But to scold is Your Trade which I soon shou'd be foil'd in
For Scolding is just quasì diceres School-din.
And I think I may say, You cou'd many good shillings get
Were You drest Like a Bawd & sold Oysters at Billings-Gate.
But Coach it or Cart it, I'd have You know sirrah,
I'll write tho' I'm forc'd to Write in a Wheel-Barrow.
Nay Hector and Swagger, You'll still find me stanch,
And You and Your Cart shall give me Chart Blanche.
Since You write in a Cart, keep it Tecta et sarta
'Tis all You have for't, 'tis your best Magna Carta,
And I Love You so well, as I told You long ago,
That I'll ne're give my Vote for Delenda Cart-ago.
Now You write from Your Cellar──I find out Yṛ Art,
You Rhyme as folks Fence in Tierce and in Cart
·(Viz:) ut tu prædicas. Your Ink is your Poison Your Pen is──What not;
·(viz:) ut ego assero Verius. Your Ink is yr Drink, Your Pen is Your Pot
To my Goddess Melpomene Pride of her Sex
I gave as You begg, Your most humbl: Respects:
The rest of Your Compliment, I dare not tell her,
For She never descends so low as the Celler;
But before You can put Your self under her Banners
She declares from her Throne You must learn better Manners.
If once in Yṛ Celler My Phœbus should shine
I tell you I'd not give a fig for Your Wine;
So I'll leave him behind, for I certainly know it
What he ripens above Ground he sowers below it.
But why should We fight thus My Partner so dear
With Three Hundred and sixty five Poems a Year?
Let's Quarrell no longer, since Dan: and George Rochfort
Will laugh in their sleeves, I can tell Yụ they watch for't.
Then George will Rejoyce, and Dan: will sing high day
Hoc Ithacus Velit, et magni Mercentur Atridæ.
«LD»Jon: Swift.
Written sign'd and seal'd five
Minutes and Eleven seconds after
the Receipt of Yours allowing seaven
Seconds for sealing and superscribing
from my Bed-side just 11 Minuts after
11. Septbr: 15th: 1718.
||||Eratum in yr last L. antepenult.
||||pro fear a Dun, lege fear a Dan.
||||ita omnes M.ss. quos ego Legi, et
||||ita magis congruum tam sensui
||||Quam veritati.
